sentences.english: The episode should serve as a warning to Europeans.
sentences.chinese: 這個小插曲對歐洲人應是個警訊。

sentences.english: For China, events in Zambia should be a warning sign.
sentences.chinese: 對中國來說，贊比亞發生的事情應該是一個警訊。

sentences.english: Although SARS is a troubling development, we have no good cause to look at it pessimistically.
sentences.chinese: SARS是一個警訊，但是我們沒有悲觀的權利。

sentences.english: He had two warnings for the commercial human spaceflight community.
sentences.chinese: 他對商業載人太空飛行界提出兩個警訊。

sentences.english: Worry is the warning light that God has been shoved to the sideline.
sentences.chinese: 掛念是一個警訊，顯示神已被推到一旁。

sentences.english: If you recognize any of the above warning signs the goal is to prevent further damage.
sentences.chinese: 發現上述任一警訊的目標是防止發生進一步的創傷。

sentences.english: It is the latest warning of the dangers of indiscreet tweeting.
sentences.chinese: 這是輕率發表推文的最新警訊。

sentences.english: Immunologists are exploring whether autoantibodies can serve as early warnings in other ways as well.
sentences.chinese: 免疫學家也正開發自體抗體做爲早期警訊以外的用途。

sentences.english: The collected personal data is solely used for activities of Junior Police Call.
sentences.chinese: 所收集的個人資料，祇供少年警訊之用。

sentences.english: 'The government data might be a warning, ' says Mr. Shiller.
sentences.chinese: “政府數據似乎可以看作是一個警訊，”席勒說。

definition: to lose one's job/unemployment/not to fulfill one's obligations/to neglect one's job/dereliction of duty
to escape (danger)/to rescue/to come out alive
lit. to have one's hands bound and be unable to do anything about it (idiom); fig. helpless in the face of a crisis
to watch with folded arms (idiom); to look on without lifting a finger
to call loudly (idiom); to get people's attention/to make one's views known
see 體格檢查|体格检查[ti3 ge2 jian3 cha2]
(of a pendulum) to stop swinging/(of work, production, activities etc) to come to a halt/to be suspended/to be canceled/shutdown/(sports) lockout
to make progress only with great difficulty (idiom)
